bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 167, Number 35 (Wednesday, February 24, 2021)][House]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mr. GROTHMAN:H.R. 1297.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Article 1 Section 8[Page H617]

item.title: Intelligence Authorization Act for Fiscal Year 2022

latestAction.text: By Senator Warner from Select Committee on Intelligence filed written report. Report No. 117-37. Additional views filed.
Message on Senate action sent to the House.

item.text: Ordered to be Reported in the Nature of a Substitute (Amended) by Voice Vote.
Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.
Referred to the House Committee on Oversight and Reform.

item.fullName: Del. Radewagen, Aumua Amata Coleman [R-AS-At Large]
Del. San Nicolas, Michael F. Q. [D-GU-At Large]

item.name: Government employee pay, benefits, personnel management

summary.text:
Air America Act of 2021

This bill establishes the service of Air America employees as qualifying service for purposes of the Civil Service Retirement System. (Air America was a government-owned airline that provided air transport for certain covert operations in Southeast Asia, including Laos and Vietnam, between 1950 and 1976.)

The bill applies to U.S. citizens who were employees of Air America or another affiliated company, as specified, between January 1, 1950 and December 31, 1976. Benefit applications must be filed within two years of the date of enactment of this bill.

bill.title: Air America Act of 2021

item.title: To provide redress to the employees of Air America.

latestAction.text: Ordered to be Reported in the Nature of a Substitute (Amended) by Voice Vote.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
